entry.title: Upload Functionality using sap bas and sap hana using fiori elements
entry.content:
Hello to readers!!!

I have created an application Incident management using capm service and fiori elements . Also I have connected to SAP HANA Cloud for it's database . 

Now I want to add upload functionality in the table toolbaar that requires to takes ".csv" file from user and then extract all the details from it and upload it on the database . 

I have made the application with the help of https://developers.sap.com/group.cap-application-full-stack.html 

PS: I have tried all the possible links provided by the SAP Community but nothing works and Don't use SAP Document Management Service , attachments entity . 

Provide the solution based on CAPM and Fiori Elements only

entry.title: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fiori in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
SAP learner here üëã

As I dig deeper into S/4HANA UX, I keep running into a pattern: even in organizations with a well-set-up Fiori Launchpad, a lot of experienced users still default to SAP GUI. I‚Äôm not trying to start a GUI vs. Fiori war‚Äîgenuinely curious about the practical reasons behind this and what has worked to shift habits

I am looking answers for the following topics: 

  • A concrete task where GUI wins (e.g., ‚ÄúDisplay/Change X,‚Äù ‚ÄúHigh-volume posting,‚Äù ‚ÄúMass edits‚Äù).

  • Why Fiori fell short (speed? feature gap? layout? navigation?)

  • Workarounds or fixes you‚Äôve tried

  • If you‚Äôve successfully moved teams to Fiori, what made the real difference? 

  • Which roles experience the biggest benefits with a switch from GUI to FIORI? Which Roles generally prefer to stay in GUI?

entry.title: i18n translations only visible with sap-ui-debug mode
entry.content:
Hi all,

We have extended an standard app (My Leave Requests), and when we deploy it into the SAP Fiori Launchpad, some i18n translations are missing:

This only happens in the SAP Fiori Launchpad; but if we add the sap-ui-debug=true parameter, the translation is displayed correctly:

We have reinitialize all the caches... Any idea?

Thx!

Miguel.

entry.title: Changing the Reject Button in My Inbox App
entry.content:
Greetings, everyone.

I need to change the dialog displayed when the Reject button is pressed in the My Inbox App.


My goal is to substitute the original text area for a combo box with options fetched from an OData service, but I'm having a hard time with it.

Every controller and view is displayed in gray, meaning I can't extend or modify it.

I'm using BAS. Someone has any idea how can I achieve my goal or how can I solve this problem?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Can I use Smart Table to display the contents of my CDS Views? I'm using v4 ODATA.
entry.content:
Whenever I try to implement this code on my Fiori app, nothing will be displayed on the screen. I tried to include a columns, column lism item but still not success on displaying the smart table. why is that?

 

xmlns:smartTable="sap.ui.comp.smarttable"

<smartTable:SmartTable
  entitySet="ZTEST_TABLE"
  tableType="ResponsiveTable"
  smartFilterId="smartFilter"
  enableAutoBinding="true"
  header="CDS Views contents">
</smartTable:SmartTable>

entry.title: FIORI: Message /IWFND/MED 170 in SLG1 when starting Launchpad
entry.content:
Hi all, 

we are getting this message in SLG1 whenever the Launchpad is started. Even if the Launchpad starts successfully, we are interested in avoiding this message to make SLG1 more transparent. 

The parameters are not filled: 
No service found for namespace '', name '', version ''

Please refer to the screenshot to see what it looks like in SLG1. In column "External Identification" is the GUID "0CC07548A0AB483380E18EC6B884EE63". What does it mean? 

Thanks for any help,
best regards

Christian

entry.title: Issue Accessing Fiori Apps using Single Sign-On with SAP IAS
entry.content:
Hey Experts,
I‚Äôm facing the following issue:
We set up a Single Sign-On configuration using this forum post as a reference:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/sap-s-4-abap-saml2-sso-with-cloud-identity-services-btp/ba-p/13565742
SSO was working fine, until we started using some Cash Flow applications, for example:
https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F0740')/S20OP
When trying to access this app using SSO, we run into the error below

Important details about our environment:
Our Fiori is standalone, and we configured SSO only for it. It connects via a trust relationship with S/4HANA.
We are using a Web Dispatcher to create an HTTPS endpoint to connect with IAS.
Accessing the app through the internal Fiori URL works. Accessing through the Web Dispatcher URL without SSO enabled also works.
So, it doesn‚Äôt seem to be a Web Dispatcher configuration issue, but rather something related to SSO.
Are there any extra configuration steps for my scenario (standalone Fiori with Web Dispatcher) that I need to perform which are not covered in the blog I used as reference?

entry.title: Feasibility of showing a popup warning in standard Fiori app F298 when changes made through custom.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In the standard Fiori app Manage Memo Record (F298), the Company Code field has an F4 help. We have a requirement where, after a certain time (for example, post 7 PM), whenever a user selects a value from the F4 help, a popup warning message should be displayed on the Fiori side.

Since this is a standard app, custom changes have been made in the backend odata services I would like to know:

What is the feasibility of implementing this?
 How can this be handled

Has anyone implemented a similar scenario where custom popup logic is triggered in a standard app?

Any guidance or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:

I would like to sort the list based on createdAt.

Bellow is part of  manifest and part of annotation.cds. No matter what I try I can not make list to be sorted.

API does no include sort either.

Any clue will help a lot. Thanks!

entry.title: Unable to access apps in launchpad- sap/bc/ui2/startup 403 forbidden status code
entry.content:
I am unable to access any of the apps in production , getting the below mentioned error.

 
An error occurred while loading this page. This might have happened due to one of the following reasons: - The page or space has been removed or is no longer assigned to you. - The URL might be corrupt. Among other things, this might be caused by a corrupt bookmark. Please copy the complete error message by using the Copy button below and contact your content administrator. PageId: "SAP_BASIS_PG_UI_FLP" SpaceId: "SAP_BASIS_SP_UI_FLP"

Symptom

  • Fiori Launchpad does not display any tiles even when the user has correct application roles assigned.
  • Fiori Launcpad search fails with error:

App could not be opened either due to an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad configuration or a missing role assignment.

Failed to resolve navigation target "#Action-search". This is most likely caused by an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad content configuration or by a missing role assignment.
  • In the network trace of browser developer tool (F12 key) you can see the  /sap/bc/ui2/start_up request returns 403 forbidden.

Imp note--- We recently upgraded to new system, everything seems to be working fine in Dev and QA. All the services needed for launchpad are activated. Basis team downloaded the roles and authorization from production and assigned it to a test user in both dev and qa , everything works fine . issue only lies in production 

Trouble shooting steps we have tried:

1. All the services are active , all the roles are authorizations are same as dev and quality.

2. I referred to sap note '3368272' which describes the exact issue i am facing , there they have given the resolution to change the security requirement in logon data of /ui2/startup node from ssl to standard, whereas everything works fine in development and quality with SSL security requirement.

We have been facing this issue for 2 weeks now , tried everything we could think of , this issue needs to be resolved asap.

Please provide your inputs , what could help.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAPUI5 Timeline Component - App Hangs with Busy Indicator Randomly.
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm developing a custom SAPUI5 application and I'm using the <suite:Timeline> component to display approval history in a cost approval workflow. The data is retrieved using a V2 OData service from the /ProcessLogs endpoint.

üìåProblem Description:

The timeline works most of the time, but intermittently, the app gets stuck on the busy indicator (oView.setBusy(true)), and the form becomes completely unresponsive. There is no error in the console, and the issue is not consistently reproducible ‚Äî it appears randomly.

This issue affects usability as the user cannot continue without refreshing the entire application.

üîßFunctional Flow

  1. On opening the form, I call the function onFetchTimelinessData.

  2. It reads from the /ProcessLogs entity using OData V2.

  3. On success, I bind the results to the Timeline control.

  4. The Timeline renders approval status history for that request.

üß© Code Snippet

VIEW CODE:-
<suite:Timeline
id="detailsTimelinedataADPD"
axisOrientation="Vertical"
showTimeFilter="false"
height="500px"
sort="false"
showItemFilter="false"
enableScroll="true"
growingThreshold="40"
content="{timelinesslogdata>/results}">
<suite:TimelineItem
dateTime="{
parts: ['timelinesslogdata>createdAt', 'timelinesslogdata>remarks'],
formatter: '.formatDateTimeWithRemarks'
}"
title="{
parts: [
'timelinesslogdata>role',
'timelinesslogdata>userName',
'timelinesslogdata>userEmail',
'timelinesslogdata>status'
],
formatter: '.formatTimelineTitle'
}"
text="{timelinesslogdata>remarks}"
userPicture="{timelinesslogdata>userPicture}"
icon="sap-icon://employee-approvals"
status="{timelinesslogdata>status}" />
</suite:Timeline>


CONTROLLER CODE: -

onFetchTimelinessData: function () {
var reqid = this._reqIDData;
var oView = this.getView();
var that = this;
var oModelV2 = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("approvalservicev2");

oView.setBusy(true); // Busy starts

oModelV2.read("/ProcessLogs", {
filters: [new sap.ui.model.Filter("reqID", sap.ui.model.FilterOperator.EQ, reqid)],
sorters: [new sap.ui.model.Sorter("receivedDt", false)],
success: function (oData) {
oView.setBusy(false); // Busy ends

if (oData && oData.results) {
var aProcessedData = oData.results.map(function (oLog) {
return {
createdAt: oLog.createdAt,
role: oLog.stage ? "[" + oLog.stage + "]" : "[N/A]",
userName: oLog.userName || "Unknown User",
userEmail: oLog.userEmail || "N/A",
remarks: oLog.stage === "Seek Clarification" ? oLog.clarification : oLog.remarks,
status: statusMap[oLog.status?.toUpperCase()] || ""
};
});

var oJSONModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel({ results: aProcessedData });
oView.setModel(oJSONModel, "timelinesslogdata");
}
},
error: function (oError) {
oView.setBusy(false);
sap.m.MessageToast.show("Failed to load process log data.");
}
});
}

 

 




Despite my efforts, I'm still looking for an effective solution. If anyone has experienced something similar or has expertise in this area, your advice would be greatly valued.

Thank you in advance for your support and time!

entry.title: SAP Fiori F5104A tab "Measuerments" Latest Reading / Measurement Points are not visible
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

i have an issue with the Fiori App F5104A and the tab measurments. I select a Technical Object (FL) and the table below measurement points has no entries. When i click on "All Readings" the measurement Point is shown and the documents for this measurment point.

I createad a measurement document with the same user via IK11 for the measurement point and it works. 

I have searched SAP notes, but i cannot find this issue. Do i have to change some settings in the SPRO? (I found, the issue, that the all readings tab is empty, but my issue is that only the latest reading tab is emtpy...)

 

 

I am grateful for any advice.

Kind regards

Jens

 

SAP: 2022 FPS02

entry.title: Connect to a back-end system from ui5 Custom Middlewares
entry.content:
We have a service called evaluation-ui (this is UI repo code),  and I want to connect it to another service called proxy-service. Both services are in the same space. Below is my setup in the ui5.yaml file.

This setup works fine when using DWC Tooling, but when we deploy the changes to the real server, it does not work."

 

The Content-Security-Policy directive name 
'https://expfeatures-manual-1.dev.us30.onesm.cloud.sap/proxy/hello' contains
 one or more invalid characters. Only ASCII alphanumeric characters or dashes '-' are allowed in directive names.

 

Request URL
https://expfeatures-manual-1.dev.us30.onesm.cloud.sap/proxy/hello
Request Method
GET
Status Code
404 Not Found
Remote Address
35.184.169.79:443
Referrer Policy
strict-origin-when-cross-origin

 

server:
  customMiddleware:
    - name: fiori-tools-proxy
      afterMiddleware: compression
      configuration:
        ignoreCertError: false # If set to true, certificate errors will be ignored. E.g. self-signed certificates will be accepted
        backend:
          - path: /ui/evaluation-srv-ui/v1/evaluation/ProgramService
            url: https://evaluation.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com
          - path: /proxy
            url: https://1sm-development-us30.cfapps.us30.hana.ondemand.com

following below doc-https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_FIORI_tools/17d50220bcd848aa854c9c182d65b699/dce5315a26964ba59d9f3e7f827dceca.html

entry.title: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)
entry.content:
Preparing for a SAP ABAP or S/4HANA interview can feel overwhelming. You spend hours revising concepts, yet when the interview starts, the real challenge is remembering which questions are most commonly asked and how to answer them with clarity.

To help you overcome this, I‚Äôve compiled the Top 25 SAP ABAP and S/4HANA Interview Questions for 2025‚Äîbased on real-world interview experiences and what hiring managers actually look for.

This post curates the most common SAP ABAP & S/4HANA interview questions for 2025‚Äîspanning DDIC, ALV, BDC, CDS, AMDP, Open vs Native SQL, ABAP on HANA, Web Dynpro and more. For clear, step-by-step answers, watch the full breakdown here:
üëâ Video: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üìå Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions (2025)

  1. What is SAP ABAP?
  2. What is the ABAP Data Dictionary (DDIC)?
  3. Difference between transparent tables and pooled/cluster tables
  4. What are SmartForms and their benefits over SAP Scripts?
  5. Difference between function modules and BAPIs
  6. What is BDC (Batch Data Communication)? Methods: recording, session, call transaction
  7. What are modularization techniques in ABAP?
  8. Difference between Classical Reports, Interactive Reports, and ALV Reports
  9. What are field symbols and how are they used?
  10. How do you define and use internal tables?
  11. What are the basic data types in ABAP?
  12. What is ABAP Objects (OOP in ABAP)?
  13. Explain inheritance and polymorphism in ABAP Objects
  14. What is a Lock Object? How is locking handled in ABAP?
  15. Open SQL vs Native SQL ‚Äì differences and use cases
  16. What are RICEFW objects in SAP projects?
  17. Explain CALL TRANSACTION and its use cases
  18. What are CDS Views and their significance in S/4HANA?
  19. What is AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedure) and why is it used?
  20. Debugging in ABAP ‚Äì breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps
  21. What is Web Dynpro for ABAP?
  22. CDS vs AMDP vs Traditional Reports ‚Äì when to use which?
  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?
  24. What tools and T-codes are essential for ABAP development?
  25. What are type groups and their purpose in ABAP?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. Interviewers are no longer just testing textbook knowledge‚Äîthey want to see if you can connect concepts to real project scenarios. These 25 questions cover exactly that mix of fundamentals + modern ABAP practices.

üìΩÔ∏è For in-depth answers, examples, and explanations, check out the full video:
üëâ Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üí° Tip: Don‚Äôt just memorize these questions‚Äîtry to explain them in your own words, link them to project experience, and always be ready with a short example. That‚Äôs what makes you stand out in interviews.

entry.title: how do I send a request to the SPA workflow from Custom fiori app?
entry.content:
Hi all,
 I'm having an issue with the SAP build process automation.  I created a simple workflow structure and deployed. After, I tested whether  the workflow service on the api.sap site and Postman.   The workflow is working and successfully ƒ± see task in myinbox. 
But when ƒ± try to request from my  custom fiori it gives error.  When I adapt the request in the post, I get a cors error.  So  I thought I definitely needed to send a request through the destination, so I created a destination from the service instance. 
my destination :


After  I described this destinationin xs.app.json file like that

      {
      "source": "^/spalast/(.*)$",
      "target": "/public/workflow/rest/v1/$1",
      "destination": "spa",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
and lastly my test requests: 

             fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "POST",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
                body: JSON.stringify({
                    definitionId: "eu10.integration-suite-dev-25mloa6z.employeeapitriggerprocess.employeeProcess",
                    context: { employee: { /* ... */ } }
                })
            });
              fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "GET",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" }
            });

ƒ±t  gives 403 error  from the POST request and 404 error from the GET request.

What could be the reason for this?  Most of the blogs I read also redirect in this way.

entry.title: Improving Website Performance with SAP Integration Insights
entry.content:
I‚Äôve been exploring how SAP solutions can support better site performance and user experience (Fashionismic.com) when businesses integrate their applications with SAP BTP. In particular, caching strategies, streamlined API calls, and optimized data models seem to play a big role.

From a UX perspective, performance directly influences how users engage with content-heavy sites, whether they‚Äôre running e-commerce stores, corporate portals, or creative platforms.

I‚Äôd love to hear from the community:

  • Which SAP tools or services have you used to improve front-end performance?

  • Any best practices for connecting SAP with modern CMS frameworks (like headless setups)?

  • How do you balance performance with personalization when pulling real-time data?

Looking forward to your insights!
